actor_awards.notes: Won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for 'The Sunshine Boys' (1975). He experienced a career resurgence in his 80s, becoming the oldest Oscar winner at the time. He also received the Kennedy Center Honors in 1988 and the Screen Actors Guild Life Achievement Award in 1995.

filmography.title: The Sunshine Boys
filmography.role_description: A retired vaudevillian who reluctantly reunites with his cranky former partner for a television special.
filmography.plot: Two feuding former vaudeville partners are reunited for a television special, but old animosities quickly resurface.

filmography.title: Oh, God!
filmography.role_description: The Almighty, who appears as a kindly old man in a fishing hat to a supermarket manager.
filmography.plot: God chooses an unassuming assistant grocery manager to carry his message to the modern world.

filmography.title: Going in Style
filmography.role_description: One of three elderly retirees who decide to rob a bank to break the monotony of their lives.
filmography.plot: Three bored senior citizens living in Queens decide to rob a bank to put some excitement back into their lives.

filmography.title: 18 Again!
filmography.role_description: A wealthy 81-year-old businessman who swaps bodies with his 18-year-old grandson after a car accident.
filmography.plot: A millionaire playboy switches souls with his awkward grandson and gets to relive his youth.

filmography.title: Just You and Me, Kid
filmography.role_description: A retired vaudevillian who takes in a teenage runaway found hiding in his car trunk.
filmography.plot: An elderly ex-performer befriends a young girl on the run from a drug dealer.

filmography.title: Oh, God! Book II
filmography.role_description: The Almighty returns, this time recruiting a young girl to help spread his influence.
filmography.plot: God asks an 11-year-old girl to create a slogan that will get the world thinking about him again.

filmography.role_description: A dual role playing both God and the Devil, who battle over the soul of a struggling songwriter.
filmography.plot: God and the Devil fight for the soul of a rock musician who sold his soul for fame.

filmography.title: The Big Broadcast
filmography.role_description: A radio station owner who tries to save his failing station by broadcasting an all-star show.
filmography.plot: A radio station manager facing bankruptcy tries to save his station by putting on a star-studded show.

filmography.title: International House
filmography.role_description: The resident physician of a Chinese hotel who gets caught up in the chaotic bidding for a new invention.
filmography.plot: Various eccentrics converge on a hotel in China to bid on the rights to a new television-like invention.

filmography.title: We're Not Dressing
filmography.role_description: A wacky researcher shipwrecked on a desert island with his wife and a group of socialites.
filmography.plot: A yacht carrying a spoiled heiress and her friends crashes on a desert island, forcing them to rely on a sailor for survival.

filmography.title: Six of a Kind
filmography.role_description: A man who, along with his wife, shares a cross-country road trip with another couple to save money.
filmography.plot: Two couples share a car on a trip across the country and get involved in a bank robbery investigation.

filmography.title: The Big Broadcast of 1936
filmography.role_description: The owner of a radio station who tries to save it from bankruptcy with a contest.
filmography.plot: A radio station owner invents a television device to broadcast a singing contest and save his station.

filmography.title: The Big Broadcast of 1937
filmography.role_description: The sponsor of a radio program who gets involved in the station's management and romantic entanglements.
filmography.plot: A radio station manager tries to put on a successful show while dealing with a sponsor and a rival.

filmography.title: College Holiday
filmography.role_description: A promoter involved in bringing students to a hotel for a eugenics experiment.
filmography.plot: A hotel owner invites college students to her resort for a 'genetic experiment' while trying to save the business.

filmography.title: A Damsel in Distress
filmography.role_description: The press agent for an American dancer who helps him woo a British aristocrat.
filmography.plot: An American dancer in London falls for a noblewoman, but her family and staff try to keep them apart.

filmography.title: Honolulu
filmography.role_description: The business manager of a movie star who tries to manage the chaos when the star switches places with a double.
filmography.plot: A famous movie star switches places with a Hawaiian plantation owner who looks exactly like him.

filmography.title: Many Happy Returns
filmography.role_description: A man who agrees to marry a wealthy man's dizzy daughter in exchange for a department store.
filmography.plot: A father pays a man to marry his scatterbrained daughter to get her off his hands.

filmography.title: Love in Bloom
filmography.role_description: The brother of a girl who runs away from their carnival family to make it in New York.
filmography.plot: A carnival girl tries to find success in New York City and falls for a songwriter.

filmography.title: Here Comes Cookie
filmography.role_description: A man who helps a wealthy father fake poverty to curb his daughters' spending habits.
filmography.plot: A father pretends to be broke to teach his free-spending daughters a lesson.

filmography.title: College Humor
filmography.role_description: A college student involved in the musical and romantic antics on campus.
filmography.plot: A college freshman becomes a football star but struggles with his studies and romance.

filmography.title: Radioland Murders
filmography.role_description: A 100-year-old comedian who is a suspect in a series of murders at a radio station.
filmography.plot: In 1939, a writer tries to solve a series of murders occurring at a new radio network's inaugural broadcast.

filmography.title: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band
filmography.role_description: A magical character who helps the band in their quest, singing 'Being for the Benefit of Mr. Kite!'.
filmography.plot: A small-town band hits it big but must battle the music industry and evil forces to save their town.

filmography.title: The Solid Gold Cadillac
filmography.role_description: The uncredited voice that provides humorous commentary throughout the film.
filmography.plot: A minor shareholder in a large corporation takes on the corrupt board of directors.

filmography.title: College Swing
filmography.role_description: A promoter who helps a woman graduate college so she can inherit a fortune.
filmography.plot: A woman must graduate from college to inherit a fortune, leading to a hired tutor and comedic chaos.

filmography.title: Movie Movie
filmography.role_description: He plays himself in the introduction and a character named Percy in the 'Dynamite Hands' segment.
filmography.plot: A double feature of 1930s-style movies: a boxing picture and a musical comedy.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy
